CatDescriptText: John Jenkins, welder, Herron Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 18, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "If you were granted an audience with Nikita Khrushchev, what would you say to him?" answer reads: "I would ask him what's he doing, what he expects to prove with the tests. I would ask him if it's real that he is trying to put fear into the world.  If the bomb testing is as detrimental as they say, I would want to know just what's the whole idea."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John Jenkins wearing moustache and light colored zippered jacket with knitted collar, standing on sidewalk in front of parked cars and buildings in background
